author: ladidan
content: > On the paragraph about "when to expire" I was thinking about an analogy/concept from classic stock management: if it was desireable to sort of "smoothen" the transition from `value of full state` to `value with less/inactive state` one could apply the method of 'movement frequency'. e.g. there's a check every 30d /12m whether an article/address was moved and if not is devalued to a certain extent until it contains no book value anymore and is removed from the balance sheet. so in essence you'd have a gradually reduced definition between active or expired.
